title: Delta Isobar Resonance Effects on Nuclear Matrix Elements for Double and Single Beta Decays.pdf
abstract: The NMEs consist mainly of the isospin (τ) axial-vector (spin σ) components. The delta-isobar (∆) resonance, which is excited coherently by the quark τσ excitation of nucleon (N) in the nucleus, is shown to quench the nuclear τσ NMEs by using experimental Gamow-Teller and spin-dipole τσ NMEs and QRPA calculations with NN and N∆τσ interactions. The quenching effect is incorporated by using an effective axial-vector coupling of g∆ A /gA ≈0.7 with gA being the couplng for a free nucleon. Impact of the ∆-resonance effect on ν studies in nuclei is discussed. Neutrino studies in nuclei. Neutrino (ν) properties such as the Majorana nature, the ν-mass, and the right- handed weak currents beyond the standard model (SM) are studied by neutrinoless double beta decays (ββ) as discussed in [1–4]. Astro-ν productions, syntheses and oscillations are studied by ν-nuclear reactions (inverse-β decays). Nuclear matrix elements (NMEs) for nuclear ββ and inverse-β decays are crucial to study these ν proper- ties of the current astro-particle physics interests. The NMEs, reflecting complex nuclear structures, are very sensitive to all kinds of nucleonic and non-nucleonic correlations. Major components of the NME are the isospin (τ) axial-vector (spin σ) ones. Accordingly, the ββ and inverse-β NMEs depend much on nucleonic and non-nucleonic τσ correlations. The β NMEs are dis- cussed in [5–11], and the ββ NMEs in [8, 9, 12–20]. A nucleus is composed mainly by nucleons (N) with τ, σ=1/2,1/2, and the NN τσ correlations are the corre- lations to be considered in ββ and inverse-β NMEs. The NME is given by a coherent sum of a QP NME for n1 →p1 and a GRN NME for Σi ni →pi and a GR∆NME for Σk Nk →∆k. ∗ejiri@rcnp.osaka-u.ac.jp delta isobar (∆= ∆33) with τ, σ=3/2,3/2 is strongly ex- cited by the quark τσ flip of the nucleon, and the N∆τσ correlations are the key non-nucleonic correlations to be considered as well for the ββ and inverse-β NMEs. The strong repulsive (V >0) NN τσ interaction pushes up the nuclear τσ strength to form the τσ NN giant reso- nance (GRN) in the 10-15 MeV region, leaving a little τσ strength in low-lying quasi-particle (QP) states. Then τσ NMEs for low-lying states are much reduced due to this τσ NN correlation. Likewise, the strong N∆τσ interac- tion pushes up the τσ strength to form the N∆giant res- onance (GR∆) at the high excitation region around the ∆mass (≈300 MeV), and pushes up some τσ strength from the N region below 30 MeV to the ∆region around 300 MeV, resulting in reduction of the τσ strength and the relevant ββ and inverse-β NMEs in the N region. The present letter aims to discuss for the first time the GR∆effects on ββ and inverse-β NMEs for such medium-heavy DBD nuclei as 76Ge, 82Se, 96Zr, 100Mo, 128,130Te, 136Xe, 150Nd and others of the current interest on the basis of the experimental τσ strengths and the GRN energies for those nuclei. Here both the NN τσ and N∆τσ correlations are considered in the framework of the NN-N∆quasi-particle random phase approximation (QRPA(N∆)).
